intro: Chaixia nathaliae, commonly known as the Nathalia's chaixia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
